hotspot.title: Welcome to BCS
hotspot.description:
We are a small school but we have big hearts and bigger opportunities.
Bundarra Central School Motto: ‘Citizenship and Knowledge’
Bundarra Central School values and provides opportunities for students to develop and grow academically, vocationally and culturally.

hotspot.title: About BCS
hotspot.description: Bundarra Central School, resides in the small rural town of Bundarra, beside the Gwydir River. The school caters for students from Kindergarten to Year 12 and has approximately 106 students. The school provides for all students through the delivery of diverse curricula, using innovative, quality focused teaching and learning.

hotspot.title: Student Opportunities
hotspot.description: Our students are engaged and active learners as they are provided with academic, cultural, sporting and innovative opportunities tailored to their needs and the needs of becoming successful lifelong learners. Senior students can access a range of H.S.C courses and vocational education pathways.

hotspot.title: School Grounds
hotspot.description: Our grounds, gardens, and neat and clean appearance obviously contribute to the tone of an orderly pleasant and productive school environment. The school has a family atmosphere with close ties to the community.

hotspot.title: Our School
hotspot.description: There are 6 stages of learning from Kindergarten to Year 12. Primary school covers Early Stage 1, or Kindergarten, to the end of Stage 3. High school covers Stage 4 to 6. Bundarra Central School is a Positive Behaviour for Learning school with the R.I.S.E core values of Responsibility, Involvement, Success and Excellence.

hotspot.title: PBL Certificates
hotspot.description: The certificate merit system is accumulative throughout the year and is restarted at the beginning of the next year. These certificates are awarded during weekly assemblies

hotspot.title: Vocational Training
hotspot.description: (VET) courses are either NESA developed courses, which may contribute to the calculation of an ATAR, or Board endorsed courses. VET courses give students work-related skills in a variety of industry areas. Students will receive a nationally recognised qualification when they complete their course.

hotspot.title: Creative Arts
hotspot.description: Arts programs are offered for students from Kindergarten to Year 12 In creative arts, students discover a variety of art forms through a study of Visual Arts, Photography and Film, where they learn to appreciate, compose, listen, make and perform.

hotspot.title: Music and Drama
hotspot.description: A specialist music teacher provides music lessons for students. Students have an opportunity to specialise in other art forms through elective subjects including Drama and Dance.

hotspot.title: Competitions
hotspot.description: The school enters a variety of Art Competitions including NERAM Let’s Hang It, Uralla Art Show and Film Festivals including being a finalist in the Focus on Ability Film Awards. Last year, two students were awarded places in the NERAM competition. Two pieces have been selected to be hung after being shortlisted.

hotspot.title: Agricultural Program
hotspot.description: Agriculture and Primary Industries help to deliver key learning outcomes as students develop a strong understanding of ‘paddock to plate’ lifestyle. Initiatives such as Junior Cattle Club and Smart Farms give students the ability to compete in local and state competitions. Recent success in the Hoof and Hook competition is reflective of the students' engagement.

hotspot.title: TAS Courses
hotspot.description:
TAS courses are studied at school with our qualified teachers.
Students are able to make industry connections through work placements.
Students have the opportunity to engage in VET courses specialising in Construction, Primary Industries, Design and Technology and Small Motors.

hotspot.title: Playground Area
hotspot.description:
A family environment is provided for students to enjoy their morning tea and lunch.
Students K-12 enjoy utilising the spaces provided. The resurfed multi-sport court, sand-pit and play equipment are popular.

hotspot.title: Stages of Learning
hotspot.description:
Students are provided with the best start to school life in our engaging and vibrant classroom.
Teachers specialise in the teaching of literacy and numeracy to support life long learners and strong foundations, and we work closely with the local Bundarra Pre-school to ensure our students have the best start to Kindergarten.

hotspot.title: Quality Lessons
hotspot.description:
All our classrooms have mobile laptop labs and are equipped with the latest technology, including interactive whiteboards, iPads, and coding robots.
Teachers work together to provide quality lessons to students.

hotspot.title: Stages of Learning
hotspot.description: Stage 1 includes Kindergarten to Year 2 (Kindergarten is referred to as Early Stage 1). Stage 2 includes Years 3 and 4. Stage 3 includes Years 5 and 6. Stage 4 includes Years 7 and 8. Stage 5 includes Years 9 and 10. Stage 6 includes Years 11 and 12. Students in Year 7 are introduced to the eight key learning areas that they will study until Year 10.

hotspot.title: Quality Teaching
hotspot.description: Quality Teaching and curriculum and delivery is a priority at Bundarra Central School. Staff regularly utilise data to track, assess and plan student learning outcomes. The K-12 staff have whole school professional learning to work together in an integrated approach to curriculum planning and delivery responsive to student needs.

hotspot.title: HSC
hotspot.description:
Senior students can access a range of H.S.C courses and vocational education pathways.
The school partnerships with The University of New England in a range of programs including Aboriginal transition days, Stage 6 Experience days, HSC Booster days and Science days at the school. These HSC courses are set and externally examined by NESA.

hotspot.title: Programs
hotspot.description:
This space is utilised by year 7-8 students to gain experience and develop skills. Further education can be undertaken in later years through specialisation.
A wide range of subjects are offered ranging from practical to theoretical classes.

hotspot.title: Hospitality
hotspot.description:
The Hospitality students prepare and serve the luncheons for significant school events.
Students utilise school grown produce to further understand the paddock to plate lifestyle.
The School Café operates Wednesdays and Fridays . The cafe is run by our Hospitality and Food Technology classes.

hotspot.title: Library
hotspot.description:
Our recently refurbished library provides a modern and innovative space where students can engage and learn.
Our teachers foster a love of reading providing life long gift for our students.

hotspot.title: Library Lessons
hotspot.description:
K- 6 students have weekly library lessons in which they immerse themselves in literature.
The library space offers a unique learning environment for our Secondary English lessons.

hotspot.title: Sport at Bundarra
hotspot.description:
Sport at Bundarra Central School is held throughout the week for both Primary and Secondary.
Our students compete under the house banners of COPETON and GWYDIR. Three major sporting carnivals are held throughout the year, these include Swimming Carnival, Cross Country and Athletics Carnival.

hotspot.title: PDHPE
hotspot.description: All K -10 students participate in Personal Development, Health and Physical Education. Wellbeing for all is promoted throughout the school.

hotspot.title: Representative Sporting Teams
hotspot.description:
Bundarra Central School has a proud history of both individual and teams representative sport.
Our PBL core values are: R.I.S.E Responsibility, Involvement, Success and Excellence.
